com.java.Avgs

Interface MovingAverage<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    IntegerMovingAverage

    public interface MovingAverage<T>
    This interface defines a data structure that provides the moving average of the last N elements added. The implementation should essentially support six functions - allow adding an element, getting an element, getting all N elements, getting the average of the last N elements and getting/changing the value of N, the window of elements to average Generics are used here to allow the implementer choose the data type, whether Integer, Long, Double, Float or some custom data type.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      This method essentially adds a new element to the list of elements.
      boolean changeWindowSize(int newWindowSize)
      This method allows for changing the current window size or N.
      java.util.List<T> getAllElements()
      This method returns a list of the last N elements added in the order they were added.
      double getAverage()
      This method computes the moving average of the last N elements.
      T getElement(int index)
      This method gets an element from the last N added elements based on the index.
      int getWindowSize()
      This method returns the current window size or N.

    • Method Detail

      • addElement

        void addElement(T element)
        This method essentially adds a new element to the list of elements.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to be added to the list. The data type is defined by the implementer.

      • getElement

        T getElement(int index)
      throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        This method gets an element from the last N added elements based on the index. It is zero indexed with respect to N, for example after adding 5 elements (N = 5), to retrieve the 1st element added, index = 0, 2nd element - index = 1 and so on. When an element does not exist at an index, it throws a java.util.NoSuchElementException exception. For example where N = 5, after adding 3 elements then call get element at index 4
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the element to retrieve
        Returns:
        (Generic) - The requested element at that index
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - This exception is thrown when an element does not exist at a requested index.

      • getAllElements

        java.util.List<T> getAllElements()
        This method returns a list of the last N elements added in the order they were added.
        Returns:
        (List(Generic)) - An ordered list of the last N elements added.

      • getAverage

        double getAverage()
        This method computes the moving average of the last N elements.
        Returns:
        (double) - The moving average average of the last N elements.

      • getWindowSize

        int getWindowSize()
        This method returns the current window size or N.
        Returns:
        (int) - The current window size or N.

      • changeWindowSize

        boolean changeWindowSize(int newWindowSize)
        This method allows for changing the current window size or N.
        Parameters:
        newWindowSize - The new value of N or the window size.
        Returns:
        (boolean) - Whether the window size was changed successfully.
